thread.title: Trent Boult's starting price is $300,000 for Indian Premier League auction
thread.title_full: Trent Boult's starting price is $300,000 for Indian Premier League auction

title: Trent Boult's starting price is $300,000 for Indian Premier League auction
text:
Trent Boult's starting price is $300,000 for Indian Premier League auction Last updated 12:22, February 7 2017 PHOTOSPORT 
Trent Boult will be hoping his timely form with the ball for New Zealand can help his chances at the IPL auction. 
Trent Boult has got a favourable Indian Premier League auction slot as he looks to translate his hot form into Twenty20 riches. 
Boult has had to go into the nerve-racking auction on February 20 after losing his position with the Sunrisers Hyderbad franchise. 
They bought him for more than $600,000 after his superb 2015 World Cup for last season's tournament but hardly used him on the back of his perplexing fall from grace with the Black Caps at the T20 World Cup. 
Boult has had his auction reserve price set at around $300,000 and might be seen as a bargain buy if his recent form with New Zealand is anything to go by. 
READ MORE: 
* ODI cricket over for Napier 
Timing is everything and, after a mixed 2016, Boult looks to be back to his best, as the big pay cheques are about to be dished out. 
Boult, who features in all three forms of the game for the Black Caps, returned the remarkable ODI figures of 6-33 in Hamilton last Sunday as New Zealand swept to a 2-0 ODI series win against Australia to retain the Chappell-Hadlee trophy. 
He ended a year's inactivity on the international T20 scene by taking three wickets in two matches in last month's series win over Bangladesh. 
Boult is joined in the auction by fellow Black Caps Colin Munro, Martin Guptill and Corey Anderson who also failed to be retained by their IPL teams. No reserve prices have been revealed for them. Ad Feedback 
New Zealand is guaranteed five players in the 2017 IPL which is the 10th edition of cricket's richest league. 
Brendon McCullum (Gujarat Lions), Adam Milne (Royal Challengers Bangalore), Kane Williamson (Sunrisers Hyderabad), as well as Mitchell McClenaghan and Tim Southee (both Mumbai Indians) have all held their places from last year. 
The tournament is set to start on April 5. - Stuff
